III  Worst-Case and Alternate- Case  Release Scenarios
Bright Harvest maintains current worst and alternate case release
scenarios on site as a
component to support emergency response within the site and LEPC.

IV   General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Ammonia
Specific Prevention
This bright Harvest Sweet Potato Company manufacturing location
complies with the OSHA Process safety management for Highly
Hazardous Chemicals (PSM) standard relative to anhydrous ammonia.
Therefore, this facility has programs to ensure proper operation
and maintenance of the ammonia refrigeration system. Further,
refrigeration system operators have been and are routinely re
-trained to maintain skills compliant in all aspects of operating
and maintaining the ammonia system within specified requirements
of the PSM program.
The ammonia refrigeration system at this facility has been
designed and constructed using good engineering practices and to
conform to industry standards. Engineering and or major
maintenance of the existing system as well as annual physical
system audits are performed by and external refrigeration
contractor to ensure system integrity.
The system includes ammonia detection devices, and emergency
shutdown switch located outside of the main mechanical room, high-
and low-level switches in pressure vessels and safety relief
valves to avert serious system overpressure. Periodic maintenance
on the refrigeration system is ensured via the use of an
effective preventative maintenance management system.
The facility maintains 24 hr security program that includes
visual hourly checks of the ammonia refrigeration system
operation during downtime periods/nights and that establishes
emergency contact protocol.

V    Five year Accident History
During the past 5 years this facility has not had one release
that resulted in an offsite evacuation and reporting. T

here is a
complete log indicating investigations into all minor vapor
release incidents. The plant maintains an emergency evacuation
drill at minimum of 1 time /year for all employees. All new
employees and visitors are trained and logged as to actions to be
taken in the unlikely event of an ammonia release. The plant
maintains adequate wind directional socks at all times visible to
the evacuation route.

VI   Emergency Response Program
At this facility the primary emphasis is to safely evacuate all
employees in the event of an accidental release, pursuant to the
requirements of OSHA 1910.38 (a). Coordination with the local
fire and LEPC is initiated during an emergency situation.

Bright Harvest Sweet potato Co., Inc.
                Clarksville, Arkansas Food Processing
Facility

                    EPA Risk Management Program
                     Executive Summary
                           May 18, 2005

I    Accidental release prevention and Emergency Response
Policies
This Bright Harvest Sweet Potato Company manufacturing site
complies with applicable federal, state and local
regulations. This food processing facility has a formal
worker safety program. All employees, contractors and
visitors are informed of hazards in the workplace. Employees
who work with potentially hazardous substances receive
proper training in the handling of those substances. This
facility has procedures in place to safely remove employees
from areas in the unlikely event that a hazardous substance
release were to occur, and to put in place notification and
response procedures. This facility meets with the LEPC on a
regular basis and is current as to emergency support and
responsibilities during the unlikely event of any emergency.
Bright Harvest has also taken part in local area risk
assessment and response planning for a myriad of emergency
situations.

II   Facility and Regulated Substances
This food processing facility is located at and known
locally as I-40 exit 58, end of Taylor (frontage) Road, and
is identified for 911 emergency services as 508 Taylor Road
(non-valid mailing address). Raw vegetables are received,
washed, peeled, trimmed, cut, cooked, mixed, formed, frozen
and packaged. The regulated substance at this facility is
anhydrous ammonia, not to exceed 19,831 lbs in a full
system, is used in a closed-loop refrigeration system for
product cooling, freezing and frozen storage.
In addition to meeting the regulated requirements Bright
Harvest also maintains complete emergency and spill plans in
place for all non-hazardous foods, process aids, oils and
cleaning agents to reduce /eliminate the risk
